clinical_study.brief_title: Yinhu Qingwen Granule in the Treatment of Viral Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Non-random Single-arm Clinical Study of Yinhu Qingwen Granule in the Treatment of Viral Pneumonia
clinical_study.source: China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-randomized single arm clinical study to observe the effect of Yinhu Qingwen Granule in the relief of fever and improvement of related-symptoms of patients with viral pneumonia.

detailed_description.textblock: Preliminary pharmacodynamic and toxicological studies can show that Yinhu Qingwen Granule has a certain effect on pneumonia caused by various viruses, and its safety is good. This study aims to observe the effect of Yinhu Qingwen Granule in the relief of fever and improvement of related-symptoms of patients with viral pneumonia.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to the normalization of the temperature
primary_outcome.description: The normalization of the temperature is defined as that the temperature of the patient dropped to normal and stabilized for more than 72 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to cough reported as mild or absent
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 3, Day 7, Day 10 and Day 30
secondary_outcome.description: The severity of cough is assessed using Cough Symptom Scale, a scale range from 0-6. 0: cough absent;1-2: mild; 3-4:moderate; 5-6: severe

The clinical recovery time is defined as the time from initiation of study treatment (active or placebo) until normalisation of fever, respiratory rate, and oxygen saturation, and alleviation of cough, sustained for at least 72 hours. Normalisation and alleviation criteria: (1) Fever: ≤36.6°C or -axilla, ≤37.2 °C oral or ≤37.8°C rectal or tympanic;(2)Respiratory rate - ≤24/minute on room air; 3) Oxygen saturation - >94% on room air; (4) Cough - mild or absent on a patient reported scale (cough symptoms score ≤ 2 points).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to dyspnea reported as mild or absent
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 3, Day 7, Day 10 and Day 30
secondary_outcome.description: The severity of dyspnea is assessed on a self-reported scale of severe, moderate, mild or absent.
Neutrophil/lymphocyte ratio (NLR) is obtained from the blood routine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of requirement for supplemental oxygen or non-invasive ventilation

secondary_outcome.description: Severe case is defined as respiratory rate ≥30/minute on room air；or Oxygen saturation - ≤94% on room air；or PaO2/FiO2≤300mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of re-hospitalization or admission to ICU

arm_group.description: For mild and common patients, take 1 bag 2 times a day. For severe patients, take 1 bag 3 times a day. All treatment should be used for 10 days unless all the symtopms of patient with the viral pneumonia are relieved.

intervention.description: For mild and common patients, take 1 bag 2 times a day. For severe patients, take 1 bag 3 times a day.
